name: Prattling Pate Lamentation
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a blissful "Lamentation".  The voice resounds, seeping into the brain.  Weeping, weeping, weeping. Ever weeping.
usage: Emits a blissful lamentation
location: Lamenter's Gaol: Lamenter's Gaol. Climb up the long ladder, cross the connecting stone bridge, and enter the room on the left, you'll find this key item on a corpse. [Map Link]

name: Bondstone
description: A large burrowstone studded with a perfectly white gem, said to be the polished form of a special kind of crystal. A ritual implement made to control explosions of spiritual power. Use to cause a spiritual explosion, consuming the sprite dwelling within spritestone. Bonds with the sprites were made to be broken.
usage: Causes a spiritual explosion, consuming sprite dwelling within spritestone
location: From the entrance of the Ancient Ruins of Rauh, head north towards the edge, and head west, you will find an area with an item below in which you can jump. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Spritestone
description: A Rauh Burrow inhabited by a sprite. Craftable item. Uses FP to release a sprite that slowly homes in on enemies. After a short time, the sprite fades away into glittering lights, causing a spiritual explosion on its passing. According to the records left by hornsent scholars, there were also contrivances known as "bondstones" that could manipulate the moment that the sprite vanishes.
usage: Uses FP to release a sprite that slowly homes in on enemies
location: Location goes here...

name: Horned Bairn
description: Doll of a tanglehorn bairn. Uses FP to summon vengeful spirits around the caster that autonomously chase down foes. Tangled horns are a symbol of spirituality, but most young born bearing the oversized horns meet a frightfully early demise. These fetishes are made to memorialize them.
usage: Uses FP to summon vengeful spirits surrounding caster
location: Drops from the Lesser Ulcerated Tree Spirit near the Ellac River Cave Site of Grace. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Perfumed Oil of Ranah
description: A small bottle wrapped in a bright-red cloth. Filled with flammable perfume oil. Uses FP to spout flames forward. The dancers of Ranah keep these concealed as they dance, marking their height of their passion with an explosion of searing flame and sweet, enticing scents.
usage: Uses FP to spout flames forward
location: Looted from the corpse in the small island found East from Cerulean Coast. The island is accessed by traversing an underground cave passage located along the coast just south near the Cerulean Coast West Site of Grace. See the Perfumed Oil of Ranah location in the [Shadow of the Erdtree Map].

name: Call of Tibia
description: An ancient ceremonial tool that uses a grave keeper's skull as a catalyst. Craftable item. Uses FP to summon one lost in death at the spot that it is thrown. The creature spins and mows down foes in the vicinity three times before dissipating. The dead have long been left to wander; what they need is leadership.
usage: Uses FP to summon one lost in death
location: Looted from a grave by a skeleton ambush. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Surging Frenzied Flame
description: Spiritgrave stone burned by frenzied flame. Craftable item. Uses FP to place a stone on the ground, where it spews frenzied flames. Spirits are eternal, and yet frenzied flame melts them away regardless. No wonder the hornsent forbid the flame's use.
usage: Uses FP to spew frenzied flame
location: Drops off the untouchable enemies in the abyss. they can be spell parried, and the riposte does damage.

name: Golden Vow (Tool)
description: Remains that turned into light after being blessed with an incantation of the Erdtree. Craftable item. Uses FP to rise into the air, increasing attack and defense of caster and nearby allies. The incantation serves as a rite that honors the comrades who placed their faith in the distant Erdtree and gave their lives in the crusade.
usage: Uses FP to increase attack and defense
location:
Shadow Keep: x3 Can be found in the area with the big golden tree, it is guarded by a Black Knight. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]
Shadow Keep: At the end of the room, hanging from a body. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Fire Coil
description: A device of fire used by Messmer's soldiers. Lingering embers, bundled into a coil. Craftable item. Uses FP to conjure tiny fire snakes from the spot that it is thrown. The writhing snakes pursue foes. Fire was a symbol of the crusade, and even Messmer's rank-and-file soldiers would wield it.
usage: Uses FP to conjure a tiny fire snake
location:
X1 Can be found inside one of the right tent in the Messmer Soldiers Camp, near the Church of Consolation. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]
Shadow Keep: Enter the eastern side of the library of the First floor of the Storehouse. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]
Shadow Keep: x2 As you reach the fifth floor from the outside area, turn right and defeat the enemy on the alcove, there is an item there. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]
Shadow Keep: x3 From the Storehouse site of grace, find the ladder and climb it up, pass the enemies. Circle the area on your right and turn back, Head all the way back to find the item. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Fire Spritestone
description: A Rauh Burrow inhabited by a fire sprite. Craftable item. Uses FP to release a fire sprite that bounces along the ground. The sprite pierces through enemies, dealing fire damage. Of all the sprites, the fire sprites are said to be the most boisterous in nature.
usage: Uses FP to release a fire sprite that bounces along the ground
location:
Past the door opened with the lever, turn to the right at the first forked path and past the shadow enemies, you will find the item on a body hanging on the edge. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]
North of the temple town ruins site of grace, past the red servants of rot, there is a cave, inside it you will find a Shadowpothead enemy. Beware of the poison traps littered around. Drops x3 Fire Spritestone, and Antiquity Scholar's Cookbook [1]. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Glinting Nail
description: Nailstone with shining fingerprints floating above. Craftable item. Uses FP to fling a magic nail that crumbles during flight. The lampreys that guard the finger ruins resemble fingers far more than they do humans, and so the finger-weavers imitated their sorcery.
usage: Uses FP to fire a shattering magic nail
location: Cathedral of Manus Metyr: Leave the main room from the opening on the side. Ride Torrent and circle the building, you will find a Marionette Soldier guarding this item. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Sunwarmth Stone
description: Spiritgrave stone blessed with an Erdtree incantation. Craftable item. Uses FP to generate sunwarmth, continuously restoring the HP of those nearby. Has a more potent effect than a Warming Stone. Sunlight feels all the warmer in darkened lands.
usage: Uses FP to continuously heal nearby allies
location: Location goes here...

name: Charming Branch
description: Branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold. Craftable item. Uses FP to stab an enemy, charming it and the surrounding enemies. Charmed enemies act as your allies for a short while. Those who would otherwise be at each other's throats are united in service to Miquella—as long as the charm that binds them remains intact.
usage: Uses FP to charm stabbed enemy and surrounding enemies
location: Location goes here...

name: Memory of Grace
description: The memory of first grace, which once guided bygone Tarnished to the Lands Between. Lose all runes and return to last site of grace visited. It is merely a cycle. Stand before the Elden Ring. Become the Elden Lord.
usage: Lose all runes, return to last site of lost grace visited.
location: All Classes start the game with this item

name: Spectral Steed Whistle
description: A delicate goldwork ring. Can be used as a finger whistle. Sound the whistle to summon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed.  (Dismounts steed when used while on horseback.) Upon his death, the spectral steed can be summoned again, but doing so drains the Flask of Crimson Tears.
usage: Summon and ride spectral steed.
location: Received from Melina after meeting her at an overworld Site of Grace beyond the tutorial area.

name: Wraith Calling Bell
description: Bell used by worshippers of revenants. Ring bell, using FP to summon prowling wraiths. This can be done multiple times in a row. Wraiths are said to be the vengeful spirits of those who died when cursed. similar
usage: Uses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths.
location: Laskyar Ruins Found in an underground room. The steps leading down can be found in the northwest section. [Map Link]

name: Ancestral Infant's Head
description: Skull of a very young ancestral spirit. Just think how many sproutings It might bear. Uses to spray spirit vapor inflicting magic damage. The vapor becomes a temporary geyser which deals continuous damage to everything it touches until it disappears
usage: Uses FP to spray spirit vapor.
location: Nokron, Eternal City Found in a chest guarded by an Ancestral Follower in a submerged ruin. [Map Link]

name: Omen Bairn
description: Doll of a curseborn bairn. Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes. Omen babies have all their horns excised, causing most to perish. These fetishes are made to memorialize them. "Please, don't hate me, or curse me. Please."
usage: Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes.
location: Subterranean Shunning-Grounds Dropped by an Omen. Assuming the area's shortcuts have been unlocked, he is located through the first two doors past the site of grace, and down the ladder.

name: Regal Omen Bairn
description: Doll of a curseborn bairn from the Erdtree's royal line.  Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes. Omen babies born of royalty do not have their horns excised, but instead are kept underground, unbeknownst to anyone, imprisoned for eternity.  These memorial fetishes are fashioned in secret.
usage: Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes.
location: Roundtable Hold Can be obtained when unlocking the Remembrance of the Omen King power by handing it over to Enia.

name: Mimic's Veil
description: Golden veil of intricate design. Uses FP to mimic nearby objects. When Godrick was hounded from Leyndell, the Royal Capital, this was one of a multitude of treasures he took with him. Also known as "Marika's Mischief".
usage: Uses FP to mimic nearby objects.
location: Stormveil Castle[Map Link]

name: Margit's Shackle
description: A fetish bathed in golden magic. Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement. Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of power — enough to trap the once-bound Margit on earth, if only for a short time.
usage: Briefly binds Margit and Morgott. Can be used twice per fight during the first phase.
location: Murkwater Cave Can be purchased from Patches for  5000 Runes after he he readies his wares for you.[Map Link]

name: Mohg's Shackle
description: A fetish bathed in golden magic. Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen,  and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under  strictest confinement. Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of power — enough  to trap the once-bound Mohg on earth, if only for a short time.
usage: Briefly binds Mohg, once imprisoned, to earth. Can be used twice per fight during the first phase.
location: Subterranean Shunning-Grounds Found at the bottom of the room filled with Fanged Imps and two Giant Crayfish.

name: Lantern
description: A small waist-worn lantern that illuminates surroundings.  Use once to turn on, and again to turn off. While its light is dimmer than that of a torch, it has the advantage of freeing up the user's hands.
usage: Attach to waist to illuminate surroundings.
location:
Liurnia of the Lakes Can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant for  1800 Runes. [Map Link]
Weeping Peninsula Can be purchased from the Isolated Merchant for  1800 Runes.[]

name: Telescope
description: Astrology tool used by members of the Carian royal family.  A stolen part of a larger instrument. Allows the viewer to better see faraway things. During the age of the Erdtree, Carian astrology withered on the vine.  The fate once writ in the night skies had been fettered by the Golden Order.
usage: Allows viewer to see faraway things.
location: Church of Elleh Can be purchased from Merchant Kalé for  500 Runes.[Map Link]

name: Blasphemous Claw
description: A slab of rock engraved with traces of the Rune of Death.  Can deflect the power of the Black Blade.  On the night of the dire plot, Ranni rewarded Praetor Rykard with these traces. Should the coming trespass one day transpire, they would serve as a last-resort foil, allowing Rykard to challenge Maliketh the Black Blade, the black beast of Destined Death.
usage: Deflects the power of the Black Blade.
location: Crumbling Farum Azula Dropped by Recusant Bernahl.[Map Link]

name: Prattling Pate "Hello"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Hello." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey. Hello
usage: Emits a voice that says "Hello"
location: Stormfoot Catacombs Found on a corpse behind the first pillar that exudes fire.

name: Prattling Pate "Thank you"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Thank you." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey.
usage: Emits a voice that says "Thank you"
location: Tombsward Catacombs

name: Prattling Pate "Please Help"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.Emits a voice that says "Please help." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey. "Please help"
usage: Emits a voice that says "Please help"
location: Impaler's Catacombs

name: Prattling Pate"Apologies"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.Emits a voice that says "Apologies." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey. Apologies
usage: Emits a voice that says "Apologies"
location: Unsightly Catacombs

name: Prattling Pate "You're Beautiful"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a demi-human head.Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey. Unconditional love. Unrestrained assurance. It must have been a mother speaking. You're beautiful
usage: Emits a voice that says "You're Beautiful"
location: Hermit Village

name: Prattling Pate"Wonderful"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.Emits a voice that says "Wonderful." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey. "Wonderful"
usage: Emits a voice that says "Wonderful"
location: Cliffbottom Catacombs

name: Prattling Pate "Let's get to it"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.Emits a voice that says "Let's get to it." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey. "Let's get to it"
usage: Emits a voice that says "Let's get to it"
location: Sainted Hero's Grave

name: Prattling Pate "My Beloved"
description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.Emits a voice that says "My Beloved." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey. Expressions of love are among the most fickle.
usage: Emits a voice that says "My beloved"
location: Miquella's Haligtree

name: Pureblood Knight's Medal
description: Proof that one is a glorious knight of the new Dynasty of Mohgwyn that the Lord of Blood will inaugurate. Use to be granted audience with Mohg. Only, it is not yet time. For Mohg yet slumbers beside the Divinity.Be Patient. The new dynasty is nigh.
usage: Teleports the player to just outside the steps of Mohgwyn Palace.
location: Reward from White Mask Varre after soaking the Lord of Blood's Favor in maiden's blood.

name: Torches
description: Weapon Range Data for Torches in Elden Ring. Credits to user Kaj.
usage: Their flames can illuminate dark locales, or be used to attack enemies. Can be raised up when equipped in the left-hand, illuminating more of the surrounding area.
location: Church of Elleh Can be purchased from Merchant Kalé for  200 Runes.[Map Link]
